Game.Name: Top Rider (Japan)
Game.plot: Overview:Top Racer is a motorcycle racing game from a behind-the-bike perspective. In both these respects, it's a very similar game to Sega's Hang-On series of motorcycle racers. The player can choose from two modes: Grand Prix, in which the player partakes in several consecutive races and Touring, in which the player can choose one of four courses for a single race.The game is notable for its unusual peripheral: An inflatable motorcycle with a special handlebar controller built-in. The player can sit on the peripheral once fully inflated and use the handlebars to control the on-screen bike.Cheat: Play With Normal ControllerAt the title screen press A, B, Right, Down, Left, Up, Right, B, A on the second controller. See, Top Rider normally requires a special controller. However, using this code should let you use a standard NES/Famicom controller.Cheat: Special Name PasswordsEnter one of these as your name during the Grand Prix mode for the specified effects.
Game.Notes: A motorcycle driving game developed by Human and published by Varie for the NES. It was released in Japan only at the end of 1988. Top Racer is a motorcycle racing game from a behind-the-bike perspective. In both these respects, it's a very similar game to Sega's Hang-On series of motorcycle racers. The player can choose from two modes: Grand Prix, in which the player partakes in several consecutive races and Touring, in which the player can choose one of four courses for a single race. The game is notable for its unusual peripheral: An inflatable motorcycle with a special handlebar controller built-in. The player can sit on the peripheral once fully inflated and use the handlebars to control the on-screen bike.
